We are looking for a hardworking and dedicated undergraduate student to hire as a research assistant. The successful student will contribute to an ongoing RPL research project, an online REDCap database of data from patients seen at the BC Women's Hospital & Health Centre RPL Clinic. This study has been approved by the UBC Ethics Board and supported by the Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility Division of the Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, UBC. Tasks include patient consenting, patient chart reviews, REDCap data entry, and management of the online REDCap RPL database. Data collection will include (but is not limited to) diagnoses, pregnancy outcomes, demographic information, patient history, prenatal blood screen results, and personal information. Charts will be reviewed within these criteria. These will be added to the already existing data and will complete our dataset. The student will also be trained in the manuscript writing process for ongoing research studies. The student will be under close supervision by the supervisor as well as one of the clinical research team members. Job Requirements Student Learning Components: The successful candidate will receive proper orientation and required training about the use of online REDCap database. Other learning opportunities for enhancing one's skill will be available as well. Continuous feedback, encouragement and support from the supervisor, other clinical research team members as well as from the REDCap team will be provided. Regular weekly meetings with the faculty members, supervisor and other research team members are expected to determine focus and prioritization. This role will enhance skills for data management and other critical analysis presentation. This experience will further help obtain a bigger project on their own or in collaboration. There is opportunity to make good professional contacts to grow professionally, academically, and personally. Required Skills: • Excellent computer skills (e.g., database management, spreadsheets, statistical programs) and proficiency with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook).
